some one is going to tell you there is a reason for breaking a file up into rars... but really this is a throwback from usenet, where stuff degrades, so breaking into rars with par2 files is essential. With torrents, it tends to work against the torrent, because once downloaded, no one keeps seeding the split files, and the torrent suffers. Truly, there is no reason to do this with torrents because torrents have built in fixes... here's a good write up that some posters just ignore... but we love themselves anyway:

http://torrentfreak.com/unpack-rar-archives-before-you-release-a-torrent/
To watch the video just extract the first file with winrar, it'll give you an AVI file.

.r1, and on files are RAR files.  A compression tool (WinRAR for example) is used which splits up the info into sections and compresses it.  helps for faster uploading and downloading usually.  Be hesitant though if you see a password protected one... those are usually bs fake stuff, remember who you d/l from and keep track of the good ones.  Torrentzone has never steered me wrong. Keep up the good work

@Benishdamenish
not a big deal, but unnecessary... and frankly, kind of annoying. The uploader wastes time splitting the rars (again, for no good reason whatsoever), and the downloaders must then waste time unraring. And once the file is concatenated, how many are going to keep the split files around? No one... which means the torrent will suffer.
Why split the files??? People shouldn't have to extract the files on a torrent! Not downloading any split files!
Too funny, so much whining. Download it or not, but don't complain about free content.

RARing uploads is oldschool & no longer necessary, especially for avi files, where there's little/no compression possible [avi files are by their very nature already compressed files].  Typically, when someone downloads a RARed file, they extract it & delete the original pieces, and we lose yet another seeder for the file.  It's not a matter of it being more/less work -- it's a matter of the file being seeded as long as possible.

Thanks for the upload. Good quality.

Stop using RAR on AVI files! It's completely pointless! AVI is already compressed so it's not like it makes it any smaller. Any benefit you THINK RAR files give you, BitTorrent negates and improves on it. It's just an extra, unneeded, pain in the ass step to unRAR the file and you can't preview to see if what you are getting is real. STOP IT!
